Box2DUtils.name: Box2DUtils
Box2DUtils.description: Box2DUtils is a set of utility-methods to help with common Box2D tasks.

Map.name: Map
Map.description: The Map represents a Tiled Map, it is created by passing the JSON data exported from Tiled in the constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: The complete map-data as exported to JSON by Tiled.

params.name: b2dWorld
params.description: The Box2D b2World. Will be created automatically if not supplied.

ObjectLayer.name: ObjectLayer
ObjectLayer.description: An ObjectLayer holds objects such as Box2D bodies or custom classes

params.name: data
params.description: The complete map-data as exported to JSON by Tiled.

params.name: map
params.description: The map this ObjectLayer is created for.

TileLayer.name: TileLayer
TileLayer.description: The TileLayer parses all tilelayers as exported by Tiled to JSON.

params.name: data
params.description: The tilelayer-data as exported to JSON by Tiled.

params.name: map
params.description: The map this ObjectLayer is created for.

Utils.name: Utils
Utils.description: Utils is a set of utility-methods to help with common tasks.

classitems.description:
Separates a non-convex polygon into convex polygons and adds them as fixtures to the body parameter.
There are some rules you should follow (otherwise you might get unexpected results) :
  • This class is specifically for non-convex polygons. If you want to create a convex polygon, you don't need to use this class - Box2D's b2PolygonShape class allows you to create convex shapes with the setAsArray()/SetAsArray() method.
  • The vertices must be in clockwise order.
  • No three neighbouring points should lie on the same line segment.
  • There must be no overlapping segments and no "holes".

params.name: body
params.description: The b2Body, in which the new fixtures will be stored.

params.name: fixtureDef
params.description: A b2FixtureDef, containing all the properties (friction, density, etc.) which the new fixtures will inherit.

params.name: verticesArray
params.description: The vertices of the non-convex polygon, in clockwise order.

params.name: scale
params.description: [optional] The scale which you use to draw shapes in Box2D. The bigger the scale, the better the precision. The default value is 30.

classitems.description: Checks whether the vertices in verticesArray can be properly distributed into the new fixtures (more specifically, it makes sure there are no overlapping segments and the vertices are in clockwise order). It is recommended that you use this method for debugging only, because it may cost more CPU usage.

params.name: verticesArray
params.description: The vertices to be validated.

return.description:
An integer which can have the following values:
  • 0 if the vertices can be properly processed.
  • 1 If there are overlapping lines.
  • 2 if the points are not in clockwise order.
  • 3 if there are overlapping lines and the points are not in clockwise order.

classitems.description: Converts a set of object definitions into a Box2D b2Body for the world-simulation.
classitems.name: makeB2DBodyFromData

params.name: objectData
params.description: The data as exported from Tiled to JSON.

params.name: world
params.description: The Box2D b2World to create the body in.

classitems.name: injectBox2d

params.name: object
params.description: The object that the b2Body is injected to

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the body, currently only 'rect' and 'circle' are supported.

params.name: widthOrRadius
params.description: The width of the body, or the radius in case of a circle.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the body (ignored if circle).

params.name: density
params.description: The density of the body, this correlated to the Box2D-physics model.

params.name: friction
params.description: The friction of the body, this correlated to the Box2D-physics model.

params.name: restitution
params.description: The restitution of the body, this correlated to the Box2D-physics model.

params.name: dynamic
params.description: Defines if the body is supposed to be a dynamic or static(non-moving) body.

classitems.description:
Updates the world simulation, forces and force-fields are applied,
this should be called on every tick before the stage updates.
classitems.name: update

params.name: e
params.description: Milliseconds since the last update (will default to 30).

classitems.description:
Sets up the Box2D DebugDraw, this is usually done automatically by the map,
but can be called from the outside to setup the DebugDraw with a different canvas.
classitems.name: setupDebugDraw

classitems.description:
Draws the Box2D DebugData to the previously setup canvas.
The target canvas is the same as the createjs.Stage if not
defined otherwise.
classitems.name: drawDebugData

classitems.description: Sets up the layers from the Tiled map
classitems.name: setupLayers

classitems.description:
Centers the 'camera' to the given object, this can be either
a Box2D Body or an createjs.DisplayObject
classitems.name: centerTo

params.name: object
params.description: The object to center the 'camera' on.

classitems.description: Generates the SpriteSheets from the Tiled tilesets
classitems.name: generateTileSets

classitems.description:
Return the tileset-frame based on a given Tiled tileid.
Note: Tiled tileids are 1-based, createjs.SpriteSheet-frames are 0-based.
This methods requires 1-based tileids.
classitems.name: getTileById

return.description: a generic object with image and rect properties. Returns null if the frame does not exist, or the image is not fully loaded.

classitems.description:
Returns the SpriteSheet for a given Tiled tileid.
Note: Tiled tileids are 1-based, createjs.SpriteSheet-frames are 0-based.
This methods requires 1-based tileids.
classitems.name: getSpriteSheetByTileId

classitems.description:
Returns the tile-properties for a given Tiled tileid.
Note: Tiled tileids are 1-based, createjs.SpriteSheet-frames are 0-based.
This methods requires 1-based tileids.
classitems.name: getTileProperties

return.description: a generic object containing the tile properties.

classitems.description:
Initializes all objects from the Tiled-map, by "objects" all non-tile-elements are meant. (e.g. custom Collision-shapes)
This is usually called on instatiation of the Layer and doesn't need to be executed from the outside.
classitems.name: initObjects

classitems.description: Creates a useable object from an object defined in Tiled. (e.g. an instance of the defined class)

params.name: objectData
params.description: The data exported by Tiled.

classitems.description:
Draws the actual tiles to the container
and creates a Graph-Map for pathfinding.
classitems.name: drawTiles

classitems.description: Calculates the collision shapes, if the layer was marked as a collisionLayer in Tiled.
classitems.name: calculateCollisionShapes

classitems.description: Finds a set of shapes in a row (only horizontal currently)
classitems.name: findNextCollisionShapeTile

classitems.description: Returns the width of the screen.
classitems.name: getScreenWidth

classitems.description: Returns the height of the screen.
classitems.name: getScreenHeight

classitems.description: Finds the stage for a createJs.DisplayObject
classitems.name: getStage

return.description: The createjs.Stage or null if not found

classitems.description:
This will return the class according to a String describing the classpath+name
e.g.: 'boxledjs.Map' will return the actual class to be used for instatiation.
This is used to reference custom classes in Tiled.
classitems.name: getDefinitionByName

params.name: className
params.description: The fully qualified name of the class. e.g.: 'boxledjs.Map'

params.name: pkg
params.description: The package to start searching, defaults to 'window'

params.name: fullPath
params.description: The full path, only used for recursive iterations, not needed for the initial call.

classitems.description:
Constructors cannot be executed with '.apply([...])' like methods, this method mocks that.
(from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3871731/dynamic-object-construction-in-javascript)
classitems.name: applyConstruct

params.name: ctor
params.description: The constructor.

params.name: params
params.description: The parameters to apply to the constructor.
